text:
Houston Baptist football hosts Central Arkansas From community reports Houston Community Newspapers 
HBU returns to Southland Conference play when it hosts Central Arkansas Saturday at 2:30 p.m. at Husky Stadium. The game will be broadcast live on American Sports Network (KHOU Bounce TV 11.2, Comcast 310, DirecTV 681-1, Dish 9517), while the Legacy Sports Network audio broadcast with Lonnie King is available on HBUHuskies.com . The Huskies (2-3, 0-2 SLC) are led by sophomore running backs Terrance Peters and B.J. Kelly. Peters has rushed for 347 yards, 86.8 per game, a touchdown and ranks seventh nationally at 7.2 yards per carry, while Kelly has rushed for 192 yards, 63.3 per game, and three touchdowns. Sophomore quarterback Max Staver has completed 32-of-70 passes for 442 yards, three touchdowns and four interceptions. Sophomore wide receiver Ethan Fry has made nine catches for 146 yards and a touchdown. Advertisement Sophomore linebacker Garrett Dolan ranks second in the Southland with 9.8 tackles per game, while sophomore linebackers Cody Moncure and Terrell Brown have made 26 and 25 tackles, respectively. Senior defensive end Josh Jones leads the Huskies with 2.0 sacks and sophomore safety Jonathan Buffin has recorded 18 tackles, an interception, forced and recovered a fumble. On special teams, sophomore punter Christian Guzman leads the league and ranks 10th in the nation with a 43.7 yard average. With an injury to senior quarterback Taylor Reed, sophomore Hayden Hildebrand will guide UCA (2-2, 2-0) this week. Hildebrand has completed 24-of-35 passes for 442 yards, five touchdowns with no interceptions. Dominique Thomas leads the Bears with 342 yards rushing and two touchdowns, while Blake Veasley has three rushing touchdowns. Jatavious Wilson has made 21 catches for 230 yards and a pair of scores, while Desmond Smith has 18 catches for 196 yards and two TDs. George Odum is UCA’s leading tackler with 30, while Devin Spurlock has made 27. The Bears have forced six turnovers, with four interceptions and two fumble recoveries. For the remainder of the season, all active military, law enforcement, fire, emergency personnel and their immediate families will be offered free admission to each HBU home game. To take advantage of this offer, please call the Ticket Office at 281.649.3143. The Huskies hit the road next week when they face Nicholls Saturday, Oct. 17, at 3 p.m. in Thibodaux, La. HEAD COACH VIC SHEALY QUOTES On last week’s win heading back into SLC play: ““We didn’t have to play many of our first-team kids past the first quarter this past week, so you get a measure of rest and recovery that you don’t get playing back-to-back conference games, so that’s a huge positive. I’m a big believer that a loss never helped anybody and a win never hurt anybody. Last week was a situation where there was a difference in the athletic ability of the two teams, probably a little reminiscent of a couple of years ago when we lined up against elite teams. We’re excited we got a win, but it’s short-lived, because Central Arkansas and the team they’re developing into, is a big, tall task this week.” On improvement from last year: “It’s always hard to qualify (how improved we are compared to last year). You see areas where we’re getting tougher and playing a little more sure of ourselves, so that you’re able to play a little faster and a little more instinctive. The faces and bodies of the kids look older and the effects of the weight room really start to have an impact on how the kids look. The practices become more competitive and the quality of your number twos become better, so I think you feel like it’s a sum of all those things you try to look at. Obviously, we weren’t very good last year and we’re trying to grow into a team that can line up and compete in this league every week. I know that we’re doing some things on game day that are showing areas of improvement, but we’re still doing some things, be it penalties, turnovers or big plays on defense, that keep us from being competitive. While we’re coaching to try to eliminate those things, we’ve got to significantly improve in order to compete. I know we’re better, but right now it’s just a week-by-week deal as you march through this conference.” On injuries: “After ACU and Sam, we really struggled with injuries. If we had played a conference team this past week, we would’ve had 8-10 kids who normally start for us that wouldn’t have played. I think we get all but two or three back, so we’ll be healthier because of rest. The next few days will determine where some kids are, but certainly we are making improvement and we got a couple of MRIs back that showed that a couple of the injuries are not serious, so we can be more aggressive with treatment to get them back on the field.”
